title: Upload container images for UD/UCMDB to a registry (OpenShift)
content:
Upload the installation images to your image registry. The image registry is a local registry on your cluster nodes or an external registry, such as your enterprise repository.

To upload the images:

  1. Log on to one of the bastion nodes.
  2. On the bastion node, go to the $CDF_HOME/scripts/ directory. Run the following command:
    cd $CDF_HOME/scripts
  3. Run the following command to upload the suite images to the local registry:
    ./uploadimages.sh [-r <image repository URL>] [-u <username>]  [-d <image download directory>
    Where:
    • <image repository URL>: Specify the -r option if you want to upload the images to an external registry other than the local registry.
    • Replace <username> with the registry username.  Use the "registry-admin" user for the local registry. The local registry refers to the default registry or the registry URL that is "localhost:5000 ".
    • If you do not specify the credentials here, you will be prompted to specify them when you run the command.
    • <image download directory>: The directory where the container images will be downloaded. The default value is /var/opt/kubernetes/offline. The -d option is the image directory where you placed the images you have downloaded. Specify the -d option if the images are not available in the /var/opt/kubernetes/offline/ directory. You can use the -d option multiple times when the images are in different directories. However, if you have specified the -l option to "false", then you can only specify one image directory. The images can be either the images download by the downloadimages.sh or the images generated by docker save. However, if there are both, the uploadimages.sh script will not upload the images generated by docker save. Only the .tar, .tgz, and .tar.gz images are supported. Make sure the image file type matches the file extension. 

    To see the full list of options for the uploadimages.sh command, run the following command:

    ./uploadimages.sh -h 
    For example: 

    ./uploadimages.sh -y -c 4 -u registry-admin


    The -p option is the password of the "registry-admin" user. The initial value of the "registry-admin" password is the password you set while you run the install to install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT). You can also change the registry-admin password with the script $CDF_HOME/scripts/updateLocalRegistryInfo.sh.

    Note
    By selecting the -p option, you are disabling or bypassing security features, thereby exposing the system to increased security risks. By using this option, you understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same.
    OpenText encourages you to use some other password options, which are not provided by OpenText. By implementing the -p option, you may expose the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. It remains at all times your sole responsibility to assess its own regulatory and business requirements.   4. Wait until the images are successfully uploaded. Your terminal resembles the following: 
    Upload-process successfully completed.
